item.title: Jessica add a quote by Octavia E. Butler
item.description:
"All that you touch You Change.
All that you Change Changes you.
The only lasting truth is Change.
God is Change." -- Octavia E. Butler

item.title: Jessica add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "may came home with a smooth round stone as small as a world and as large as alone." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If the path before you is clear, you're probably on someone else's." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If you can see your path laid out in front of you step by step, you know it's not your path. Your own path you make with every step you take. That's why it's your path." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Half the people in the world think that the metaphors of their religious traditions, for example, are facts. And the other half contends that they are not facts at all. As a result we have people who consider themselves believers because they accept metaphors as facts, and we have others who classify themselves as atheists because they think religious metaphors are lies." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy - in fact, they are almost incompatible; one emotion hardly leaves room for the other." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Once a month, some women act like men act all the time." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A dying culture invariably exhibits personal rudeness. Bad manners. Lack of consideration for others in minor matters. A loss of politeness, of gentle manners, is more significant than is a riot." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "I've found out why people laugh. They laugh because it hurts so much . . . because it's the only thing that'll make it stop hurting." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Almost any sect, cult, or religion will legislate its creed into law if it acquires the political power to do so." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "May you live as long as you wish and love as long as you live." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Octavia E. Butler
item.description: "When your rage is choking you, it is best to say nothing." -- Octavia E. Butler

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Octavia Butler
item.description: "Drowning people Sometimes die Fighting their rescuers." -- Octavia Butler

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Octavia E. Butler
item.description: "There is no end To what a living world Will demand of you." -- Octavia E. Butler

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "If you knew what was going to happen, if you knew everything that was going to happen next—if you knew in advance the consequences of your own actions—you'd be doomed. You'd be ruined as God. You'd be a stone. You'd never eat or drink or laugh or get out of bed in the morning. You'd never love anyone, ever again. You'd never dare to." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Ignoring isn’t the same as ignorance, you have to work at it." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Stupidity is the same as evil if you judge by the results." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "We were the people who were not in the papers. We lived in the blank white spaces at the edges of print. It gave us more freedom. We lived in the gaps between the stories." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Nobody dies from the lack of sex. It's lack of love we die from." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "You can only be jealous of someone who has something you think you ought to have yourself." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "What am I living for and what am I dying for are the same question." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "There were a lot of gods. Gods always come in handy, they justify almost anything." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Time folds you in its arms and gives you one last kiss, and then it flattens you out and folds you up and tucks you away until it's time for you to become someone else's past time, and then time folds again." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Maybe the life I think I'm living is a paranoid delusion...Sanity is a valuable possession; I hoard it the way people once hoarded money. I save it, so I will have enough, when the time comes." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Beginnings are sudden, but also insidious. They creep up on you sideways, they keep to the shadows, they lurk unrecognized. Then, later, they spring." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "It's impossible to say a thing exactly the way it was, because of what you say can never be exact, you always have to leave something out, there are too many parts, sides, crosscurrents, nuances; too many gestures, which could mean this or that, too many shapes which can never be fully described, too many flavors, in the air or on the tongue, half-colors, too many." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert
